intro: Psilosiphon gracilis, commonly known as the slender glasswort, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it thrives in saline and well-drained conditions. Its structure includes a low-growing, branched stem with fleshy, bluish-green leaves that help it retain water. Psilosiphon gracilis plays a role in stabilizing dune systems and is often found in maritime environments.
